attributes.comment:
I think this fee increase is nothing but an anti immigrant effort to stop immigration
in the United States. However, it is wrong and unfair. The government is not
taking into account the cost of living increase and the difficult financial situation
most of us are living in the United States as a consequence of the War and all
related issues.

Indeed, the new fees will stop people from filing applications with the Service and
probably the Service will get up to date with their backlogs due to the lack of
filings but that won't reduce the number of undocumented immigrants in the United
States. Having people legalize in the United States should be a priority instead of
turning people away from that path. It is sad and a shame that the government
would turn their back to the people who makes this country

If the government needs to increase their income, it should raise only the fees of
employment and business related applications because those people are capable
of paying higher fees. However, raising the fees for adjustment applications
knowing that most of those are related to family immigration is unfair. The
government is targeting the poorest kind of immigrant. Tell them to target the
richer and not the poorer. I cannot stop thinking about the millions of working
class immigrants who will not be able to afford the government ridiculous fees.

At last, the government should consider the access of these immigrants to legal
representation. As an immigrant I have never even consider the possibility of
submitting any applications ot the government without legal representation.
Immigration laws in this country are anti immigrant, tricky and confusing. With
the current fees, and the current misleading information provided by USCIS many
individual file their applications on their own to later find out they are not eligible for
the benefit sought. However, some immigrants are able to make the extra effort
and obtain legal representation before submitting any applicaitons to ensure that
their money will be rightly expense. If the government raises its fees outrageously
as proposed, immigrants will not be able to obtain legal representation and will
end up throwing money for no benefit in the governments hands. As you may
know, USCIS never returns funds to applicants.

This fee increase is very unfair.

Respecfully,

Kathia Pereira,Esq.
attributes.title: Comment Submitted By Kathia I. Pereira, Pereira and Associates LLP
